results.title: The Art of piano
results.creator_credit: Donald Sturrock, Pierre-Olivier Bardet, Stephen Wright, Ideale Audience, IMG Artists and La Sept-Arte
results.brief_description: The Art of Piano features some the greatest concert pianists of the Twentieth Century playing the greatest music ever written for piano. The documentary follows the development of the profession of concert pianists from the turn of the 19th Century, beginning with Franz Liszt up until the 1970s and compares the various interpretive styles of these great musicians. Excerpts of actual footage of performances by concert pianists are interspersed with interviews with contemporary pianists, and conductors or fellow performers. Essential viewing for anyone studying piano or lovers of piano music. Includes footage of Ignace Jan Paderewski, Josef Hofmann, Sergei Rachmaninoff, Benno Moisewitsch, Vladimir Horowitz, Gyorgy Cziffra, Myra Hess, Artur Rubenstein, Annie Fischer, Francis Plante, Alfred Cortot, Wilhelm Backhaus, Edwin Fischer, Emil Gilels, Sviatoslav Richter, Arturo Benedetti Michelangeli, Glenn Gould and Claudio Arrau.

results.title: The Aristocats
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman, Winston Hibler and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Featuring the voices of Phil Harris and Eva Gabor, this Disney animated favourite is filled with lovable characters and “swingin’ music”. When an eccentric millionairess wills her entire estate to her pet cats, her greedy butler abandons them in the French countryside so he can inherit the money himself. Duchess and her three adorable kittens embark on an adventure-filled journey back to Paris, with a street-wise Casanova alley-cat named O’Malley.

results.title: The Art of low fat cooking
results.creator_credit: Andrew McDonald and Video Distributors International
results.brief_description: This video looks at ways people should reduce added fats, both in cooking and food preparation. It promotes a healthy lifestyle using the “diet pyramid” as a guide. It also explores ways to reduce fats found naturally in foods and encourages alternative food selections. Presented by Gabriel Gate for the International Diabetes Institute in co-operation with Life Be In It.

results.title: The Animatrix
results.creator_credit: Andy Jones, Koji Morimoto, Mahiro Maeda, Peter Chung, Shinichiro Watanabe, Takeshi Koike, Yoshiaki Kawajiri, Lana Wachowski, Lilly Wachowski, DNA Films (GB), Mad House, Silver Pictures, Square USA and Studio 4 C
results.brief_description: These nine short films, from eminent directors and animators, explore the concepts of the enormously popular cult science-fiction film “The Matrix” (Andy Wachowski, Larry Wachowski, 1999), fleshing out side and back-stories of the principal narrative. “The Final flight of the Osiris” (dir. Andy Jones): When the crew aboard a hovercraft witness a menacing mechanical army amassing, one woman travels, at great peril, to the other side. “The Second Renaissance Part 1” (dir. Mahiro Maeda): Explains how human beings became the architect of their own demise by inventing robots to do their bidding, before the machines, desiring autonomy and freedom, rose up against their masters. “The Second Renaissance Part 2” (dir. Mahiro Maeda): The war of man versus the machines begins. “Kid’s story” (dir. Shinichiro Watanabe): A high school student who discovers the truth about the Matrix goes on the run from secret agents. “Program” (dir. Yoshiaki Kawajiri): In a segment with medieval overtones, two warriors engage in a fierce battle whilst debating the meaning of existence. “World record” (dir. Takeshi Koike): A talented track star discovers the secrets behind the Matrix. “Beyond” (dir. Koji Morimoto): Whilst searching for her missing cat, a young woman discovers a dilapidated building where children reside with the power to defy gravity and slow down time. “A Detective story” (dir. Shinichiro Watanabe): Paying homage to film noir, a private investigator goes in search of Trinity. “Matriculated” (dir. Peter Chung): Several members of the human resistance attempt to reprogram a machine to fight for their side.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andy Jones, Koji Morimoto, Mahiro Maeda, Peter Chung, Shinichiro Watanabe, Takeshi Koike, Yoshiaki Kawajiri, Lana Wachowski, Lilly Wachowski, DNA Films (GB), Mad House, Silver Pictures, Square USA and Studio 4 C

results.title: The Art and craft of Maningrida
results.brief_description: Shows the preparation of the arts and crafts of the Maningrida people of Northwestern Australia for a gallery exhibition, intercut with scenes of tribal dancing and ceremonies. Indicates the role played by crafts in the culture of these people.

results.title: The Appraisal interview: 'How am I doing?' (NP)
results.brief_description: Designed to bring home sharply to the line manager the potential problems in failing to conduct appraisal interviews professionally. John Cleese shows shows that there is a logical technique and pinpoints the three most common managerial attitudes that can sabotage the appraisal interview. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: The Amy Johnson story
results.creator_credit: Nat Crosby, Innes Lloyd, BBC-TV and Compact Television
results.brief_description: In 1930, Amy Johnson was the first woman to fly solo to Australia and she became the idol of the masses. In 1941 she mysteriously vanished. This fascinating BBC production dramatises her life, from being “the most famous woman in the world” to marrying Jim Mollison, a pilot who is envious of her triumphs to the final and tragic end. Features Harriet Walter as Amy Johnson.

results.title: The American Film Institute salute to James Cagney
results.creator_credit: Bill Foster, Paul W Keyes, American Film Institute and Paul W Keyes Productions
results.brief_description: This series from the American Film Institute (AFI) salutes some of the biggest stars that helped shape the face of Hollywood as we know it today. James Cagney, one of the Hollywood greats, acted in over 60 films. Remembered mostly for his gangster roles and the delivery of the now famous line “You dirty rat”, Cagney’s repertoire was diverse and included comedy, musicals, westerns and Shakespeare. Hosted by Frank Sinatra, this tribute, both informative and entertaining (winning an Emmy Award in 1975 for Outstanding Television Programme), celebrates his career with a top line-up of stars contributing anecdotes along with excerpts from many of his films. Frank Sinatra delivers a wonderful version of ‘My Way’ with lyrics written to honour Cagney. Guest speakers include: Mae Clarke, Doris Day, Kirk Douglas, Frank Gorshin, Charlton Heston, Bob Hope, Jack Lemmon, Shirley MacLaine, Ronald Reagan, George Segal, George C. Scott, Cicely Tyson and John Wayne.

results.title: The American Film Institute salute to Henry Fonda
results.creator_credit: Marty Pasetta, Eric Lieber, George Stevens Jr and American Film Institute
results.brief_description: This series from the American Film Institute (AFI) salutes some of the biggest stars that helped shape the face of Hollywood as we know it today. Henry Fonda is attributed as acting in more than 93 films, over 100 television appearances and 72 stage plays. To celebrate the life and work of actor Henry Fonda, the AFI in this presentation uses footage from over 40 films with introductions from some of Fonda’s celebrated colleagues: Jane Alexander, Lucille Ball, Richard Britton, Gregory Peck, James Stewart, Bette Davis, Kirk Douglas, Jane Fonda, Peter Fonda, Jack Lemmon , James Garner, Charlton Heston, Ron Howard and Lillian Gish.

results.title: The American Film Institute salute to Fred Astaire
results.creator_credit: Marty Pasetta, George Stevens Jr and American Film Institute
results.brief_description: This series from the American Film Institute (AFI) salutes some of the biggest stars that helped to shape the face of Hollywood as we know it today. Fred Astaire whose career as a dancer, actor and singer is honoured here with the AFI’s Lifetime Achievement Award after a career of more than 77 years and a screen career of more than 40 films. This remarkable and versatile actor whose reputation was established in the films made with actress and long-time dance partner Ginger Rogers is joined by his colleagues in a celebration of his contribution to film including excerpts from the films, ‘The Gay divorcee’, ‘Top hat’, ‘Funny face’, ‘Swingtime’, ‘On the beach’, ‘Finian’s rainbow’ and ‘The Towering inferno’ to name a few. David Niven hosts the event with speaking guests including: Mikhail Barishnikov, Cyd Charisse, Barrie Chase, Bob Fosse, Audrey Hepburn, Charlton Heston, Gene Kelly, Hermes Pam, Eleanor Powell and Leslie Caron.
